reviewText: Slashers are a fun guilty pleasure. They are made for the purpose of outdoing each other in body count, sex and gore. Suspense? Storyline? who needs it. As long as you have a killer stalking and cutting up oversexed teenagers with an IQ of 5, it's kept interesting, or it was, in the 80's. In 1995, "Scream" was made and gave new light to the slasher genre. The movie was sucessful, spawned two sequals, and many more slashers. However, with each of these new slashers, they do little to actually add more to the genre. These new slashers that come out are so concerned with keeping a story, that it loses itself in bordem. "Cherry Falls" falls into that category. This movie is just another boring new slasher that does little to keep the viewer's attention. It tries building up a story, yet, it becomes so boring that no one cares. There is some gore I suppose, but in comparision to other slashers before it, it's quite tame. It's also predictable, and that's not a good thing.Right from the start, this movie screams "predictable" and "unoriginal". At the first scene, we have a couple making out in a car by a lake. Suddenly, a car pulls up behind them and the boy gets out of his car to see what is going on. Guess what happens next? For anyone who actually knows how a slasher movie works (It doesn't take a rocket scientist), you'd think the two of them get killed, and, you're correct, they do...In between killings, we do have a plot buildup, it's quite boring too. A girl learns a dark secret of her father's past. The killer has an all too predictable motive. Sound familiar? It's been done!...This movie is just a prime example of how slashers have fallen into repetitve boringness...
summary: Hey, Jay Mohr is in this movie
Title: N/A

reviewText: Cherry Falls is another teen/school horror film. That's not necessarily a bad thing. This one, however, has a different take on the usual killer m.o. Brittany Murphy stars as a small town girl who realizes that her sheriff father, played by the always solid Michael Biehn, has some dark secrets to a serial killer who's preying on virgins. There's the twist. Normally, the killers go after the ones who have sex. It's not anything extraordinary, but it's a nice twist. Brittany Murphy is a great actress. She is a great heroine. She's real and believeable. The great Candy Clark plays her mother. Unfortunatley, she has a small role and doesn't get much to do. The killer's identity may be pretty visible for some people, might not be for others. Jay Mohr co-stars as a teacher. The movie is very sexy and the climax is pretty messy. It's nothing new, but as far as the genre it's in, it's above average. Give it a try. It's not half bad.
summary: A Slasher Film With A Twist
Title: N/A

reviewText: It's "Scream" meet's "Twin Peaks" in Cherry Falls, as a Small Town Maniac Knocks Off some Oddball, Sexually Repressed characters. Is it just me or did every character in this film, at one time or another, smile at another character in "that certain way".On first viewing, this film looks like a straight faced slasher flick, but as you delve deeper, you see it's satirical edge, which is also done very straight faced. (anyone expecting "Scary Movie" will be sorely dissapointed)It really is a very well made Horror flick, only missing out on the 5th star as it's a little too familiar to the 90's horror Father "Scream". In fact, out of all of Scream's Offspring, this one is most familiar. It doesn't follow Screams rules, but it has it's feel. Geoffrey Wright's Direction is Above average, less flashy than most, Michael Biehn is always a welcome face and he leads the film and the town as the sherrif and father of Britney Murphy, playing the girl-who-just-won't die.P.S. Finally, a Horror film with a killer that can run really fast, he doesnt stalk like Pepe-la-phew. (a la "I know what you did last summer")
summary: Perfect Mix Of Satire and Serious-ness. (is that a word?)

reviewText: Cherry Falls is a very good slasher. Murphy and Mohr add good acting to a new story. A killer who kills virgins. There was good suspense and the movie had a good ending. It keeps you guessing. I think it could be slow in parts. This is definitely a lot better than a lot of the slashers that came out after Scream. It's close to being on the same level as I Know What You Did Last Summer and Urban Legends but not like stinkers Valentine. I wouldn't spend twenty five bucks  on the dvd but I would pick up the vhs because it's usually a reasonable price. Enjoy!

reviewText: "Cherry Falls" boldly struts onto the horror genre stage, bathed in self-importance and confidently carrying the air of "something new." It is one of the most unpleasant movie experiences of my life.Flavor of the month Brittany Murphy is Jody, a pasty high school student having problems with her horndog boyfriend Kenny (Gabriel Mann). Kenny wants to do it, Jody does not, and the two break up. This occurs the same night another teenage couple are hacked to death. Jody's dad is Sheriff Marken (Michael Biehn), who stoically investigates the killings.After another student is killed, Marken goes to the high schoolers' parents with a tidbit of information- the killer carved the word VIRGIN into the victims, and it seems the victims were in fact virgins. This causes a giant uproar, as the students decide the only way to save themselves from the killer is to have sex, and the parents half heartedly say no. Jody is attacked at the meeting, and has a sketch done of the killer. The killer is identified as a girl who disappeared from town over two decades before, and suddenly town secrets start rising to the surface. Jody does her own investigation, and the prerequisite bloody climax (sorry) occurs at the giant high school sex party.This film made me sad. The director went with a bunch of browns and earth tones, the likes of which I have not seen since I last changed my son's diaper. All the students have a pasty look to them. Everyone seems to wear black, even the sheriff and his deputies sport the latest in brown wear. This is depressing to watch. I also came to hate every character in the movie. When watching a slasher film, one should not feel more sympathy for the killer than for the victims. All the adults here are troubled alcoholics who are quick to get into dumb fistfights (the school meeting). All the high schoolers here are stupid horny pot heads who make jokes about the killings. Why bother hoping these people make it until the end of the film?Wright, who somehow went from directing "Romper Stomper" to this mess, gets some real mean murders out of his film. However, he also falls for every damn cliche you have seen in every other damn slasher film. From the jump cut (heroine bumps into someone who turns out to be harmless), to the villain coming back to life one final time, I wanted to throw something at the screen. There is a germ of morbid humor near the end of the film, watch for a severed hand in a student's hair, but it is too little too late."Cherry Falls" is bathed in unpleasantness. I thought I was going to need a shower after this. Hopefully, this new round of slasher flicks is ending so we can wait another twelve years for "something new" to come along. "Cherry Falls" and should have stayed down.

reviewText: The movie "Cherry Falls" is not very good, even for its type.  The movie is about a psycho path killing virgins in Cherry Falls, Virginia, but there is more than meets the eye.  The sheriff, played by Michael Biehn, harbors a dark secret which may have something to do with these killings.  It actually sounds more interesting than it is, but the movie is really lacking in suspense.  Also, I thought the acting was pretty bad to be frank, except for Michael Biehn, who did a pretty good job.Like so many 90s and modern day horror flicks, "Cherry Falls" starts off fairly well, but fades quickly as the movie lacks a credible horror movie like atmosphere...the result is a generic slasher flick with an undeniable 90s feel and which is totally unconvincing and clearly lacking in substance and style...perhaps, this is due in part to the below average acting as well.After the audience discovers the killer's identity, a very tiresome and boring scene ensues and "Cherry Falls" declines drastically from there to the pathetic ending.  If you are looking for lost slasher movie classics, I recommend "The Burning", "He Knows You're Alone", "Madman" and "Just Before Dawn" as horror movie "diamonds in the rough" so to speak.
summary: Lackluster slasher flick with lame script.

reviewText: I caught this straight to video movie on the Independent Films Channel. A slasher film with a decent enough cast, Michael Biehn, Brittany Murphy, and Jay Mohr, it is scary, campy, and funny. It has all the makings of a future cult classic.The plot is simple. Someone is killing the virgins of Cherry Falls, Virginia, so the film centers around its high school and its resident teens. Brittany Murphy capably and engagingly plays the part of Jody, a teenage girl who has remained a virgin, despite some  hot and heavy scenes with her hunky boyfriend of a year. She also has a special interest in one of her young teachers (Jay Mohr).When the killing begins, Jody's father (Michael Biehn), the town's sheriff, goes into action to try and discover just who is killing off the virgins in his town. When his daughter is nearly the killer's next victim, it dawn on the sheriff that the answer may revolve around a twenty-seven year old mystery that he knows more about than he cares to say.The teens come up with an interesting solution to the serial killer problem. Simply get rid of your virginity and ensure your safety. While this is going on,  however, the killer goes about his bloody business. Just who is the killer, and why are the town's virgins being killed? Watch the film and find out.  If you are into horror films that are a bit campy, as well as funny, then this film is worth a rental.
summary: SOMEONE IS KILLING THE VIRGINS OF CHERRY FALLS, VIRGINIA...

reviewText: During a time when slasher films are becoming nothing but bad acted cheese balls, comes this dark and enjoyable slasher film. The plot is good, a serial killer targeting virgins, the twists are fun, and the atmosphere is dark and moody. It is also good to see Candy Clark back on the screen. This film is definitely worth checking out. The ending was a little disappointing, but all in good fun. At least it made sense...This is definitely recommended...

reviewText: This is one of those yet again slasher teen pics gone into the waste disposal. This time its in a town called Cherry Falls, Virginia. A killer is on the loose and apparently killing virgins...hmm killing virgins in Virginia...get it? Anyway, it seems past secrets resurface to haunt the town. When the whole town finds this out..every single teenager in school goes and throws a sex party. This floppy non suspenseful movie proves again slasher movies can be kind of boring after awhile. I totally Saw Jay Mohr (Last Comic Standing, GO) as the killer coming a mile away...it's not hard to pick up the clues and get the character. Also starring Michael Biehn (Tv's Hawaii, Jade), Brittany Murphy (Just Married, Spun), Michael Weston (Wishcraft), Jesse Bradford (Swimfan, Bring It On), DJ Qualls (The New Guy, Road Trip), Candy Clark (Buffy The Vampire Slayer Movie), Gabriel Mann and Keram Malicki-Sanchez (Tv's Buffy The Vampire Slayer, Happy Campers). The beginning was a total Twin Peaks rip off.
summary: Cherry Peaks Twin Falls ScreamI Know...wait...what the hell?
Title: N/A

reviewText: OK, if you love "Friday the 13th" and "Halloween" but always seem to laugh when the victims get their just desserts--this is THE movie for you!It's full of smiles and a very good spoof horror flick with none of the cheese(well, some).The characters are well developed with actual histories and personalities that draw a viewer in and make them want to know more.Cherry Falls has some dirty secrets. As do all small towns in scary movies. The main character is the sheriff's daughter who has a few boyfriend problems of her own. Her Mom is just plain strange, her Dad overly potective, her favorite teacher is overly attentive, and all her friends want to do is lose their virginity. So, what's a girl to do?The town is experencing a rash of murders. Slashing here and there and well everywhere.Who or what is the killer? Believe me when I say that you're going to want to know. The dialogue in this movie is funny. Even better watching it the second time with the knowledge of "knowing" the ending. Fun fun fun.The spoofs are hysterical without being so cheesy that it becomes too unbelievable to watch. Keep your eyes on this movie and enjoy the laughs. If you're a horror fan--all the classic elements will be there.  Think "Jamie Lee Curtis"'s cousin in a small town near Bates Motel during a few summers after "I Still Know What You Did Last Summer" and throw in a little "Freddy Krueger" sense of humor minus the boiler room, gloves and sleep deprivation.I told ya--it's a cool flick!
Title: N/A

reviewText: This trashy teen horror starts off with a clever premise then swiftly shows itself for what it is - another cheesy horror flick.  According to scary movie rules only virgins can escape killers.  This movie turns it on its head, with a killer that only goes after virgins.  Of course this leads to a high school of horny teenagers desperate to lose it before they get targeted next.Brittany Murphy is a good actress and really deserves better material than this but unfortunately is stereotyped as a typical scream queen here.  The rest of the cast merely revolve around her and the list of red herrings is ridiculous.  With anything like this, if the movie isn't intelligent or clever it should at least be entertaining.  This isn't.  In fact it's rather dull, and there are no scares here whatsoever.  Why it got such a high rating is anyone's guess as there's barely any gore save a few silly flashbacks.Yet the film's main problem is that is doesn't know whether it's a knowing romp, a subversive scary movie or just plain teen horror.  It tries to be all three.  On the one hand it has its premise (which makes the movie all the worse for not making good use of it) but on the other it has a few amusingly corny pieces of dialogue.  However, it is the movie's primary revelation though that is most interesting.  Without giving it away, this thorny issue could have been very interesting, but `Cherry Falls' just presents it to us without discussing it at all.The movie poses various questions throughout its running length.  Should Murphy lose her virginity to her long-standing boyfriend?  Should we feel sympathetic towards the killer?  Yet the one that keeps popping back up seems to be `should we care?'
summary: Good idea, shame about the movie

reviewText: 25 years ago a horrible crime was comitted in the town of Cherry Falls, because of what happened in the past, a serial killer has targeted teenage virgins. While the sherif and the FBI plan to catch the killer, the kids have a plan of their own. After Jody is attacked by the killer word soon goes around that the killer is after virgins. Jody seems to be the main target and her father, the sheriff, seems to know more then he is telling.  WOW, these new slasher movies seem to be getting better and better, god bless Scream. First of I'll I'm glad I got to see this on the big screen although it was highly cut (and shows). There are so many good things about this movie, the main thing would be the plot, how cool, a killer targeting Virgins and actully has a damn decent reason for killing as well. The killer also looked really cool when in costume,  well it wasn't really a costume but he/she looked really cool. The acting in this movie is very good Brittany Murphy is the standout one great screamer then there is Michael Biehn who was the good guy from The Terminator, he's also very good and there is one of my fave actors Jay Mohr, heck the whole cast is brilliant.  Cherry Falls is filled with alot of suspence and the killings are rather violent, I can't wait for the uncut DVD to appear.  Cherry Falls is brill see it NOW.
